page.title: 11DOWNE SCOUT CAMP
page.content:
DOWNE SCOUT CAMP
Downe Scout Camp is a very big centre for outdoor recreation. The London Rovers started the camp in 1929. The camp covers 86 acres. there is an assault course, and a swimming pool there. Scouts and guides from all over the world use this camp, but mostly visitors from abroad are Europeans. Each year 32,000 people use the camp. It is open in the winter when nearly every weekend a hundred people stay, mostly in bunk houses. The manager runs the scout camp with one full-time assistant and lots of voluntary workers. One of the improvements he would like to see is an indoor swimming pool. The existing outdoor pool holds 78,000 gallons and was opened by Lord Baden-Powell.
